page.title: 02LANDSCAPE
page.content: The landscape is predominantly green & undulating around Aberangell. Lush fields of grazing sheep & cattle climb both steep & gentle slopes of hills which fold into each other to distant views along the valley, where the river meanders. Stretches of fields are broken by hedgerows of blackthorn & hazel, & great oaks ash sycamore & larch trees spread their branches in the stream valleys. Across the top slopes of some hills can be seen the soft blanket of varied forestry pines, creating a patchwork of green shades. The village settles into the hillside between the river & Clipiau (common land) & further smallholdings & cottages across the land give the human element to a landscape full of nature's glories. Stone & slate are the main building material & there are many corrugated tin garages & sheds.
